channel.title: Can someone explain the stream class to me?
channel.description:
I'm playing around with packetTypes and packet sizes etc, etc, there is a lot of readUnsignedByteA() and similar methods. I've looked over them a few times but I'm still not at a complete understanding how they work. I also don't understand their correlation with buttons, objects, etc.
Could someone please explain these things to me?

item.title: Can someone explain the stream class to me?
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

That’s a little better, thanks guys.
I understand the unsigned concept, as I’ve read everything on the wiki. xP

My question in more detail though, say I’m working with object clicking, which is the opcode for that is 31 and byte length is 6. How would I know which methods within the stream class to use to get information like the object ID, and location of the object?

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone explain the stream class to me?

item.title: Can someone explain the stream class to me?
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

A data stream which retains the connection to the client; sending and receiving information. ReadUnsignedByteA() reads a byte from the client, and subtracts 128 and adds 0xff.

When a player clicks a button, data is sent to the server (in the case of buttons, two hex’d bytes), which when decrypted, holds the id of the button in which was clicked.

Correct me if I’m wrong.

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone explain the stream class to me?

i don’t think java supports unsigned types - probably why
[/quote]Yes it does.[/quote]

like what…besides char (unsigned short)
